description: {"blocks":[{"key":"878lt","text":"This method uses a metagenomic approach to analyze the genome sequence of RNA viruses. Nucleic acids outside the viral particles are reduced using nucleases and extracted to obtain template RNA. Templates are converted to double-stranded DNA, and library preparation is performed for analysis on Illumina sequencers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9lqs","text":"Analysis data with reduced sequences of host and bacterial origin and abundant sequences of viral origin are obtained, allowing multiple samples to be analyzed even with the throughput of the iSeq100.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4579n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42oql","text":"This protocol was folked from \"Preparation of viral sequencing library for Illumina using WTA2 and QIAseq FX\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ids4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Kenichi Komabayashi

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"c8gnd","text":"There are three advantages to using this method.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75hrg","text":"(1)No need to design virus-specific primers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1in8p","text":"(2)RNA viral genomes can be analyzed while reducing nucleotides of host and bacterial origin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i6gm","text":"(3)10 or more samples can be analyzed at a time on the iSeq100 (For viral genome less than 10,000 bases)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95vm7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54r8b","text":"The method consists of two parts: pretreatment and library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uvoq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt515","text":"The pretreatment is intended to increase the content of virus-derived nucleic acids in the sample and facilitate genome analysis. The main point of this method is to reduce host genome, ribosomal RNA, and nucleic acids derived from bacteria in advance, taking advantage of the fact that genomes in viral particles are not easily digested by Nuclease.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"108ph","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adct6","text":"NEBNext Ultra II RNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (E7770) is used for library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej8tq","text":"The following points are different from the method described in the attached manual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sd0m","text":"(1) Use half the scale of the protocol in the manual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lbe5","text":"(2) The number of cycles of PCR amplification is increased because the initial RNA input is small.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6b3p","text":"The amplified libraries are pooled into a tube for multiplex analysis. The size and molar concentration of the pooled libraries are adjusted to obtain a final library that can be applied to the flow cell.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bl502","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
